template.name: Vagtindkaldelse
template.body: Se https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Historical_releases.ashx for oversigt over, hvad der deployes. Se https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.On-call-duty-for-deployment.ashx for praktisk beskrivelse af vagt-ordningen."

template.name: Byggeindkaldelse
template.body: Se https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Building-hotfix-delivery-for-version-0-X.ashx for beskrivelse af at bygge releasen. Se https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Historical_releases.ashx for oversigt over alle releases"

template.name: Kodefrysindkaldelse prototype
template.body: All new functionality and corrections for reported errors must be pushed to the development branch before code freeze. Please pay attention to the push-policy as described in: https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Push-policy.ashx Please refer to the wiki page for the specific branch: https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Historical_releases.ashx However, bug fixes for errors caused by new code may be allowed until build time, but only after agreement with Søren or Jens-Peder.

template.name: Kodefrysindkaldelse hotfix
template.body: The hotfix will only contain bug-fixes that have been pushed to the hotfix branch before the code freeze. Please pay attention to the push-policy as described in: https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Push-policy.ashx Please refer to the wiki page for the specific branch: https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Historical_releases.ashx

template.name: Dokumentationsindkaldelse prototype
template.body:
Remember to fill out any relevant information about packages, change requests or webservices included in the upcoming release.
See https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Implementation-comments-and-prototype-notes.ashx for a description on what to write in the release notes.
Also make sure, that any manual steps needed to install or setup the application are described in release notes and/or installation guide.
Prototype notes folder: https://nordealivogpension.edlund.dk/Coauthor%20Documents/Prototype%20Notes Implementation comments folder: https://nordealivogpension.edlund.dk/Shared%20Documents/Designspecifikationer/30%20Implementation%20comments Installation guides folder:https://nordealivogpension.edlund.dk/Shared%20Documents/Installation%20Guides" Changes after deadline must also be sent to nlp.baselining@edlund.dk.

template.name: Dokumentationsindkaldelse hotfix
template.body:
Remember to fill out any relevant information about packages, change requests or webservices included in the upcoming release.
See https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Implementation-comments-and-prototype-notes.ashx for a description on what to write in the release notes.
Also make sure, that any manual steps needed to install or setup the application are described in release notes and/or installation guide.
Prototype notes folder: https://nordealivogpension.edlund.dk/Coauthor%20Documents/Prototype%20Notes Implementation comments folder: https://nordealivogpension.edlund.dk/Shared%20Documents/Designspecifikationer/30%20Implementation%20comments Installation guides folder:https://nordealivogpension.edlund.dk/Shared%20Documents/Installation%20Guides" Changes after deadline must also be sent to nlp.baselining@edlund.dk.

template.name: Dokumentationsreminder
template.body:
Please remember that an essential part of delivering packages and Change Requests is documenting it. You are not done before all of the below has been completed. [FREEZE]
Describe manual steps needed to install or setup the application. If you have made changes that require manual action before the application can be installed or set up, describe the in the release notes if it is a one-time change, or in the installation guide if it is a general change to the installation process.
The installation guide and the prototype notes can be found here: https://nordealivogpension.edlund.dk/Coauthor%20Documents/Release%20Documentation
Fill out release notes: Remember to fill out any relevant information about packages, change requests or webservices included in the upcoming release. List all specifications that describe the package/CR as well as all specifications describing implementation comments. All documents must be baselined versions (see below)
See https://wikirubicon.edlund.dk/NLP.Implementation-comments-and-prototype-notes.ashx for a description on what to write in the release notes.
Make sure specifications are baselined: Make sure that all specifications are baselined. If any packages or CRs being delivered, have not been baselined yet, request it immediately via the Baselining requests list (https://nordealivogpension.edlund.dk/Lists/Baselining/AllItems.aspx).
Write and copy implementation comments to SharePoint: Any changes to specifications during development must be documented as separate version of the specification. These versions must be approved by the NLP package responsible before being delivered.
Naming convention is: '[Original name] Impl [Package/CR]'. For example: 'H02 Underwriting v17 Impl CR12345'.
The document’s version log must include a line describing t change, starting with 'Impl [Package/CR]'. For example: Impl CR12345: Several fields have been made mandatory.
Upload the implementation comments to SharePoint: Implementation comments folder (https://nordealivogpension.edlund.dk/Shared%20Documents/Designspecifikationer/30%20Implementation%20comments)
Also list alle the implementation comment documents in the release notes under the 'Implementation comments' section for the relevant package/CR.
